name: 陳怡倩
objective: 本課程主要介紹質性研究中傳統的研究法，藉由深入探討採用不同質性研究方法的研究報告、以及實地進行質性研究以幫助學生掌握各項質性研究方法的運用與分析方法的技巧。
schedule:
Week 1　　2/16　　Course Introduction　　
Week 2　　2/23　　Introduction to qualitative inquiry
��　　         Qualitative vs. Quantitative research　　
Week 3　　3/2　　Five qualitative research traditions
��　　         Qualitative data collection and sampling
Week 4　　3/9　　Library Tour
��　　         Academic Database Introduction　　
Week 5　　3/16　　Five Traditions I: Biography　　
Week 6　　3/23　　Five Traditions II: Phenomenological study　　
Week 7　　3/30　　Five Traditions III: Grounded theory study　　
Week 8　　4/6　　Five Traditions IV: Ethnography　　
Week 9　　4/13　　Five Traditions V: Case Study　　
Week 10　　4/20　　Data collection I: Interviewing
Week 11　　4/27　　Data collection I: interview coding
Week 12　　5/4　　Data collection II: observation
Week 13　　5/11　　Data collection III: spoken interaction
Week 14　　5/18　　Data analysis & representation　　
Week 15　　5/25　　Qualitative Verification
Week 16　　6/1　　Final project meetings　　
Week 17　　6/8　　Final paper presentation　　
Week 18　　6/15　　Final paper presentation & paper due
scorePolicy: Attendance & participation (15%), topic presentation (15%), case study (10%), weekly assignments (30%), final project & presentation (30%)
materials:
Required Textbooks:
Creswell, John W. (1998).Qualitative Inquiry and Research Design: Choosing among Five Traditions. Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage Publications.
Marshall, Catherine, & Rossman, Gretchen B. (1999). Design Qualitative Research (3rd). Thousand Oaks: Sage Publications. 
Richards, Keith. (2003). Qualitative Inquiry in TESOL. New York, NY: Palgrave Macmillan.

Suggested References:
Cresswell, John W. (2003). Research Design: Qualitative, Quantitative, and Mixed Methods Approaches (2nd). Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage Publications.
Maxwell, Joseph A. (1996). Qualitative Research Design: An Interactive Approach. Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage Publications.

Patton, Michael Quinn. (1990). Qualitative Evaluation and Research Methods (2nd). Thousand Oaks: Sage Publications.
Seidman, Irving. (1998). Interviewing as Qualitative Research: A Guide for Researchers in Education and the Social Sciences. New York, NY: Teachers College Press.
